channel.title: Posts on See Fan Go
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on See Fan Go

item.title: PEI 10 Day Travel Guide
item.description: Prelude For a 10 day packing list for September, check out this post. I’ll have an update on how that list worked for me sometime in the future. üí° I started writing out the entire 10 day travel plan (with commentary) as a single post, except it got really long and I was getting antsy. So like we say a lot in software development... ship early, ship often. I'll start with a very barebones overview for each day, and then slowly trickle out the more detailed commentary for each day, and update this post with links as I publish.

item.title: Week of Workouts: PEI Hotel Edition
item.description: One of the things I look forward to the most when I travel is access to a different gym. Since I do all of my workouts at home, and my home gym is mostly barbell based, it’s nice to just have the excuse and the equipment to do something different. The hotel we stayed at (Hampton by Hilton) had all the usual equipment - treadmills, elliptical, recumbent bike, cable machine, kettlebells, medicine balls, dumbbells - that I expect from a hotel gym, but also a stair climber (which I unfortunately couldn’t turn on… I love stairs), and the dumbbells went up to a meaty 75lbs, rather than just the usual 50lbs.

item.title: 10 Days in PEI Packing List
item.description: This has been lightly edited from the original reddit post, which you can see here. I first looked into the one-bag lifestyle during my grad trip, and I’m proud to say that I’ve come a ways since my 65L backpack (checked) onebag days. I’m pretty frugal, and the items certainly reflect that. Hopefully this can help anyone else who feels like they “can’t get into onebagging” because they can’t afford all the cool technical (expensive) items this sub talks about.

item.title: First
item.description: Alright, we’re 9 months into the year and it’s time to take a look at the goals I’ve set for myself, according to my GitHub README. üöÄ Goals for 2022 üí™ Hit a one plate bench üçÖ Harvest many tomatoes üíû Train the cats to go for walks üë©‚Äçüç≥ Master one dish from each continent ‚úçÔ∏è Start a (non-tech) blog Well, I got stuck at 115lbs for bench (year’s not over yet!
